00017 package WeBWorK::DB::Record;
00018 
00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 WeBWorK::DB::Record - common functionality for Record classes.
00022 
00023 =cut
00024 
00025 use strict;
00026 use warnings;
00027 use Carp;
00028 
00029 =head1 CONSTRUCTOR
00030 
00031 =over
00032 
00033 =item new($Prototype)
00034 
00035 Create a new record object, set initial values from the record object
00036 $Prototype, which must be a subclass of WeBWorK::DB::Record.
00037 
00038 =item new(%fields)
00039 
00040 Create a new record object, set initial values from the hash %fields, which
00041 must contain keys equal to the field names of the record class.
00042 
00043 =cut
00044 
00045 sub new {
00046     my $invocant = shift;
00047     my $self = bless {}, ref($invocant) || $invocant;
00048     
00049     if (@_) {
00050         if (UNIVERSAL::isa($_[0], __PACKAGE__)) {
00051             $self->init_from_object($_[0]);
00052         } elsif (ref $_[0] eq "HASH") {
00053             $self->init_from_hashref($_[0]);
00054         } elsif (ref $_[0] eq "ARRAY") {
00055             $self->init_from_arrayref($_[0]);
00056         } else {
00057             $self->init_from_hashref({@_});
00058         }
00059     }
00060     
00061     return $self;
00062 }
00063 
00064 # this will have to be changed if we actually implement any custom accessors/mutators
00065 sub init_from_object { shift->init_from_hashref(shift) }
00066 
00067 sub init_from_hashref {
00068     my ($self, $prototype) = @_;
00069     @$self{$self->FIELDS} = @$prototype{$self->FIELDS};
00070 }
00071 
00072 sub init_from_arrayref {
00073     my ($self, $prototype) = @_;
00074     @$self{$self->FIELDS} = @$prototype;
00075 }
00076 
00077 =back
00078 
00079 =head1 BASE METHODS
00080 
00081 =over
00082 
00083 =item idsToString
00084 
00085 Returns a string representation of the object's keyfields.
00086 
00087 =cut
00088 
00089 sub idsToString {
00090     my $self = shift;
00091     return join " ", map { "$_=" . (defined $self->$_ ? "'".$self->$_."'" : "undef") } $self->KEYFIELDS;
00092 }
00093 
00094 =item idsToString
00095 
00096 Returns a string representation of the object's fields.
00097 
00098 =cut
00099 
00100 sub toString {
00101     my $self = shift;
00102     return join " ", map { "$_=" . (defined $self->$_ ? "'".$self->$_."'" : "undef") } $self->FIELDS;
00103 }
00104 
00105 =item toHash
00106 
00107 Returns a hash representation of the object's fields. If interpreted as a list,
00108 the fields will be in order.
00109 
00110 =cut
00111 
00112 sub toHash {
00113     my $self = shift;
00114     return map { $_ => $self->$_ } $self->FIELDS;
00115 }
00116 
00117 =item toArray
00118 
00119 Returns an array representation of the object's fields.
00120 
00121 =cut
00122 
00123 sub toArray {
00124     my $self = shift;
00125     return map { $self->$_ } $self->FIELDS;
00126 }
00127 
00128 =back
00129 
00130 =cut
00131 
00132 sub _fields {
00133     my $invocant = shift;
00134     my $class = ref $invocant || $invocant;
00135     my @field_data = @_;
00136     
00137     my %field_data = @field_data;
00138     my @field_order = @field_data[ grep {$_%2==0} 0..$#field_data ];
00139     my @keyfields = grep { $field_data{$_}{key} } @field_order;
00140     my @nonkeyfields = grep { not $field_data{$_}{key} } @field_order;
00141     my @sql_types = map { $field_data{$_}{type} } @field_order;
00142     
00143     no strict 'refs';
00144     
00145     # class methods that return field info
00146     *{$class."::FIELD_DATA"} = sub { return \%field_data };
00147     *{$class."::FIELDS"} = sub { return @field_order };
00148     *{$class."::KEYFIELDS"} = sub { return @keyfields };
00149     *{$class."::NONKEYFIELDS"} = sub { return @nonkeyfields };
00150     *{$class."::SQL_TYPES"} = sub { return @sql_types };
00151     
00152     # accessor functions
00153     foreach my $field (@field_order) {
00154         # always define a "base" accessor
00155         # custom public accessors can use this to actually do the getting and setting
00156         *{$class."::_base_$field"} = sub {
00157             my $self = shift;
00158             $self->{$field} = shift if @_;
00159             return $self->{$field};
00160         };
00161         # if there isn't a public accessor in the subclass, alias it to the base accessor
00162         next if exists ${$class."::"}{$field};
00163         *{$class."::$field"} = *{$class."::_base_$field"};
00164     }
00165 }
00166 
00167 sub _initial_records {
00168     my $invocant = shift;
00169     my $class = ref $invocant || $invocant;
00170     my @initializers = @_;
00171     
00172     no strict 'refs';
00173     *{$class."::INITIAL_RECORDS"} = sub { return @initializers };
00174 }
00175 
00176 1;
